channel.title: Grub Serial Menu in virsh console
channel.description:
@Patrick @Patrick_mobile
https://askubuntu.com/questions/924913/how-to-get-to-the-grub-menu-at-boot-time-using-serial-console
Tested and confirmed. Modifying the /etc/default/grub like below makes a grub menu appear during virsh console boot now.
# Kernel console on both serial and kvm/local console GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX="console=tty0 console=ttyS0,115200n8 rootdelay=60" # Show grub menu on both serial and kvm/local console GRUB_TERMINAL="console serial" GRUB_SERIAL_COMMAND="serial --unit=0 --speed=115200 --word=8 --parity=no --stop=1"

item.title: Grub Serial Menu in virsh console
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
@Patrick @Patrick_mobile

askubuntu.com

How to get to the GRUB menu at boot-time using serial console?

boot, 16.04, grub2, console
asked by feitingen on 11:24AM - 13 Jun 17 UTC

Tested and confirmed. Modifying the /etc/default/grub like below makes a grub menu appear during virsh console boot now.

# Kernel console on both serial and kvm/local console
GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX="console=tty0 console=ttyS0,115200n8 rootdelay=60"
# Show grub menu on both serial and kvm/local console
GRUB_TERMINAL="console serial"
GRUB_SERIAL_COMMAND="serial --unit=0 --speed=115200 --word=8 --parity=no --stop=1"
